availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. McClain (Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace.)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Carpenter McClain. Father of Shelby Knight McClain. Farmer in Shelby County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Shelby County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Appointed Justice of the Peace in Shelby County on November 19, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 2, p. 133.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 2, p. 292A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 7, p. 541B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 24092.
KYR-0001-017-0251.
